properties.Name: Excavation site (old road)
properties.description:
This site first discovered 12 years ago. A layer containing bricks and stones found below ground, which are possibly part of a traditional paved road. During original excavation, the remains of a clay pipe (like a water pipe) was also discovered here. A teracotta ganesh lamp was also found here.

There is also a sand layer going above the stone layer, which cannot be explained. The road possibly led to the Chibha.

properties.Name: Old well (still unexcavated)
properties.description: The spot is marked by a small tree. Location: 20 ft from edge of the canal, and 74 ft from the road

properties.Name: Chibha
properties.description: The Chibha that can be seen on the road en route the Ku-dey

properties.Name: Ku Dey hiti
properties.description: A stone spout used to be here. The current boundary wall has probably been made closer to the spout than before, ie. earlier space must have been marked as larger than current.

properties.Name: Maa dwon
properties.description:
Possible residence of army personnel (senapati)... could have also been a site for emergency meeting calls. Current ruins suggest triangular shape.

The site is still used for ritual practice.

properties.Name: Machaa Ga
properties.description: Funeral site for infants

properties.Name: Mha vinkigu chwaka
properties.description: The place for bathing after funerary rites. Also a religious location. Guthi members and guthi gurus need to visit this spot for their rituals.

properties.Name: Jugnichaa
properties.description: Also called Jug Nani. Kapali's funeral site (graveyard).

properties.Name: Excavation Site (either road or courtyard)
properties.description: Layer of paved bricks discovered. Excavated area is a long rectangle, where one edge has a mound of some brick parts that might be from a fallen building.

properties.Name: Excavated hole
properties.description: A concrete pillar of the Fast Track taken out from here. Excavated hole shows layers of bricks, that may have been part of an old road.

properties.Name: Excavation site (well)
properties.description: This well was discovered 12 years ago and parts of it were damaged then. The well shows two layers of construction: the core well layer and an outer support layer. The area surrounding the well has stone paving. Further details in the notes.

properties.Name: Fallen ruins of paati/ guthi building
properties.description: This structure was standing until the 2015 earthquake.

properties.Name: Kaifat dya
properties.description: This is a shrine on the road. It is in a rectangular cavity. In the floor level which is below ground level, one can see a long stone with rectangular bevel which contains a smaller square cavity. This was possibly where the hinge-pole of a door was placed, meaning there must have been a doorway here. Which in turn suggests the shrine may once have been housed in a structure with a doorway, which no longer exists.

properties.Name: Excavation site (Laa Ba)
properties.description: This site also has brick paving. A narrow path of paved stones extends from it and goes westwards. Site not entirely excavated.

properties.Name: Du hiti
properties.description: A buried stone spout. Water comes out from the site but the spout itself is not visible. Not excavated

properties.Name: Sikhali stone with mark
properties.description: A stone in the middle of the fork with marked symbol.

properties.Name: Fast track marker stone
properties.description: 506 marker stone placed here

properties.Name: marked areas is Khaa Si
properties.description: This used to be old pond (now no longer visible).

properties.Name: Janma Dwar
properties.description: The is the stepped underground drinking water source (Opi)

properties.Name: Marked area is a spot for funerary rites
properties.description: Waiting area for family and funeral attendees.

properties.Name: Di: pa
properties.description: This is a funeral pyre area. In the past funeral burning took place on a rock which is now below ground.

properties.Name: Bajaa tha
properties.description: Site for musicians during funeral.

properties.Name: Di: pa
properties.description: Here a white stone marks the spot for alternate funeral site (extra site).

properties.Name: Pinga shrine
properties.description: The open air shrine contains a carved decorated arched design where shrine idol is placed, the style dating from Malla era. But inside the archway are the broken remains of small carved pillars dating from Lichhavi period. Shrine is surrounded by upright large rocks. At the back of the shrine is a stone gajur (temple pinnacle). These suggest the shrine may have once been housed in a structure, possibly made of stone.

properties.Name: Hiti
properties.description: Location of stone spout, currently in ruins. Used to be functioning until around 25 years ago.

properties.Name: Pinga Si
properties.description: A religious/ culturally important site. The rituals traditionally held at this site became discontinued 6-7 years ago, and now continued only as a locally conducted bhwe (feast).

properties.Name: (extent of fast track road)
properties.description: This is how far road will reach after measuring 82 ft from the marker

properties.Name: Cultural route of Sikhali dance
properties.description: Marked path is route of Sikhali Dance

properties.Name: Site of old stone landmark
properties.description: Only the stones that were part of the base remain

properties.Name: Pond
properties.description: Concrete set circular pond. No water here since the modern construction (historically, there was a water pond here).

properties.Name: Khwat Bahal
properties.description: Site of old Bihar

properties.Name: Kokhu Gha
properties.description: Location of ghat

properties.Name: Ta: Dan
properties.description: Old name of Taudaha

properties.Name: Kwena Aaju
properties.description:
Now known as Jalbinayak. The stone there is known as Kwena Aaaju.

Breakdown of Kwena:
Kwe= lower
Naa= water

Kwena meaning the water falling at the lowest point (suggesting this site is connected to historically important dates related to the draining of the valley).

properties.Name: Dah mo dya
properties.description: Called karkat naag but known as Dah mo dya, which is a pillar like stone around 25-30 ft tall rock. Also called Hammo dya. This site is part of the major ritual at Khokana which takes place every 12 years.

properties.Name: Speculated site of flower exhibition hall
Land of Himal Cement Factory
properties.description: This plot may also be used for dry port/ exhibition hall

properties.Name: Thathu Ghat
properties.description: Location of mill. Its location here suggests a water source may have been nearby. Which means it was build at a time when the nearby river had a different route.

properties.Name: Dhammar
properties.description: Said to be the location where Dharmakar's passed away.

properties.Name: Funeral ritual site
properties.description: The spot where sun dried brick used in funerals are left there.

properties.Name: Pan Chwo
properties.description: Pan cha khya. The Pan cha guthi site. Also the location where dewali is celebrated (dewali meaning kul puja, worship of clan deity).

properties.Name: Potential archaeology site
properties.description: The remains of foundations of many building seen here 20 years ago.

properties.Name: Potential archaeology site
properties.description: Remains found here (connected to other nearby site) also 20 years ago (about)

properties.Name: Kwokhya Guthi
properties.description: Possible funeral site when Nekhu river used to have different route.

properties.Name: Chakhun Tirtha
properties.description: Ancient Buddhist route.

properties.Name: Archaeology site
properties.description: Kori Bahal/ Ko: bahal

properties.Name: Na: ni
properties.description: Ancient buddhist bahal location

properties.Name: Pan paa
properties.description: Traditionally used location for getting soil which may have been used for construction (and maybe also used in painting).

properties.Name: Ta paa
properties.description:
Bakhaa:

An old public space site. Traditionally/ historically provided shade to passerbys. Also a site for making gundruk/ sinki.

properties.Name: Taa pukhu and hiti
properties.description: Location of water source

properties.Name: Samal Pukhu
properties.description: Samal Pukhu "Sansar ma nabhayeko pokhari".

properties.Name: Line marks Katan: Gadh
properties.description: Location of old fort

properties.Name: Ujan Dwo
properties.description: This spot is highest in the village. Said to be a spot used to send a command in case of external attack. Or possibly a signal area.

properties.Name: Line marks Na: Ran Ga
properties.description:
Location of another fort site.
The river may have passed by this site. The fort may have been built next to water when the river used to have this route.

properties.Name: Bharaa Ga
properties.description: Ga means forest in Nepal Bhasa.

properties.Name: Bulakhaa
properties.description: A falcha and water tank used to be here

properties.Name: Chwa Khwana
properties.description: Said to be an old site of making weapons.

properties.Name: Kwa ra
properties.description: This site mentioned by a Chinese traveler. Location of a hot water pond (from "Kwau La"... hot water).

properties.Name: Gwa daha
properties.description: Said to be the origin site of Gopalis. A pond still exists here.

properties.Name: Laa ku
properties.description: Site of palace

properties.Name: Khaska paa
properties.description:
Later named Khau paa. Flowers for mul jatra for Khokana brought from this location. This practice continues.

Lapti and muu-swan. Needed for sikhali rituals brought here.

(This is the name of the whole hill)

properties.Name: Pla bi
properties.description: Specific tree around this area from where the pla bi (seed/ nut used to make amulet for children) is taken from.

properties.Name: Chain da dha
properties.description: Old water level of the lake. An old water source also here.

properties.Name: Karpa
properties.description: This range called Karpa. In 2038 BS this part of the hill was swept away by river

properties.Name: Mahalaxmi
properties.description: every 12 years, residents of Khwana visit here for rituals (for bringing the deity from there)

properties.Name: Matiko Aaaju
properties.description: This part said to be over water even before Chobhar opened

properties.Name: Dela people's funeral pyre area
properties.description: Dela people had traditionally performed funeral rites for their dead here. Not allowed to burn here anymore as this site got encroached by the road/ neighborhood. Around 20 years have passed since this practice stopped.

properties.Name: Bajrabarahi
properties.description: Another important site for residents of Khwana.... every 12 years visited for rituals Just as in Mahalaxmi (same day).

properties.Name: Halchowk Shakti
properties.description: Another site for ritual once every 12 years

properties.Name: Pashupati
properties.description: Another location visited every 12 years

properties.Name: Guheswari
properties.description: Another location visited every 12 years

properties.Name: Mahankal
properties.description: Another location for ritual every 12 years

properties.Name: Indrayani
properties.description: Another spot for ritual every 12 years

properties.Name: Bishnudevi
properties.description: Another location for ritual every 12 years

properties.Name: Brahmayani
properties.description: Another location for ritual every 12 years. This deity is right next to indrayani

properties.Name: Jalbinayak
properties.description:
Another location for ritual every 12 years.

Amasi Guthi is located here. The Amasi Guthi has the responsibility of applying oil on Jalbinayak deity stone. The Amasi Guthi does to take any tax/ payment when performing rituals for Khwana.


Also located here is Saapu Guthi, the cowkeepers guthi. They perform rituals for worshipping grain. The belief is that this is what allows planting and ploughing with bullock (their rituals needed for these two actions).

properties.Name: Sikhali temple
properties.description: Also a site where Khwana people perform their 12 year rituals
